quoteFirst: Lord Kitchener now threw himself into the task of concentrating and organising a relieving Army. He telegraphed at
quoteLast: on October 3 asking the French War Minister to make all preparations to send the proposed two divisions with cavalry and artillery complete as soon as possible and to let him know how soon they could be dispatched. He was asked in reply whether he would prefer one Territorial Division with a complete brigade of _Fusiliers Marins_.
title: The World Crisis, Volume 1 (of 6)
author: Churchill, Winston, 1874-1965

quoteFirst: She was flying the Norwegian flag, which was also painted on her sides. At
quoteLast: the _Alcantara_, then about 2,500 yards on the quarter of the stranger, began to hoist out a boat for the purpose of boarding. At this moment the other vessel opened a heavy fire from her hitherto concealed armament, throwing her Norwegian ensign and staff overboard and hoisting a German ensign at the main.
title: The Grand Fleet, 1914-1916
author: Jellicoe, John Rushworth, 1859-1935
